result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Robert Henderson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Robert Henderson in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Christopher Robert Henderson.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense received discovery and requests a status date to allow time to go over materials with client. Court grants request. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Robert Henderson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Christopher Robert Henderson appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Court orders balance to be returned to the person who posted.   
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Christopher Robert Henderson in court with Attorney David Thomas Conley.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/2/22 @ 1:30p
